page.title: 15Ashlyns Farm
page.content: Ashlyns form grows wheat, barley, potatoes and oil seed rape. The crops are sent to the common market countries. They own 290 acres and 2 people work on the farm. It was first owned by Richard Ascelyn. He worked there 600 years ago. The Royal college of Physicians owned it from 1672-1922. It is now owned by Mr Collins. They havent got much machinery now. They have got 4 ploughs and 1 potato bed fall which digs up the earth in lines so that potatoes can be planted. Also 1 potatoe harvester. They put their crops in the barn to dry. Behind the farm house there are the remains of a moat which went round a manor house. It is a shallow pebbly stream overgrown with nettles, docks and long grass.
